column1: Pumice floats on the water because of the holes that pool water, which keeps the water from moving over the pumice, or through it. In the picture, you can see the holes that collect the water. These holes give the pumice its porosity, but also its low permeability, because they are not connected.

The holes that are shown in the rock do not appear to be connected so it would have low porosity but the example said that the water would only be floating for a matter of hours giving it a high permeability.
